column2: Myanmar sets $2.80 daily minimum wage in bid to boost investment YANGON
column3: Aug 29 Myanmar has set a minimum wage of 3
column4: 600 kyat ($2.80) for an eight-hour work day
column5: a move likely to boost investment in the fast-growing country's garment industry.

column3: JVs after product review -chairman in paper ZURICH
column4: Aug 29 Syngenta AG may seek partners to help improve its product lineup after a thorough review in the wake of a rebuffed takeover approach from Monsanto Co
column5: the agrichemicals group's chairman told a Swiss newspaper.

column2: Largest Dutch pension fund exits Mylan over death penalty concernsUPDATE 1-Largest Dutch pension fund exits Mylan over death penalty concerns AMSTERDAM
column3: Aug 29 The Dutch public employees' pension fund
column5: has sold all its shares in pharmaceuticals maker Mylan after it emerged that one of the company's products is in stock at a U.S. prison where death sentences are carried out.  UPDATE 1-Largest Dutch pension fund exits Mylan over death penalty concerns AMSTERDAM

column2: Buffett's Berkshire takes $4.48 billion stake in Phillips 66 Aug 29 Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  disclosed a $4.48 billion stake in oil refiner Phillips 66
column3: rebuilding a bet it had made in the energy industry before oil prices fell.
